Description: Fragment of an ear-ring made of red jasper, the body is getting thinner towards the end of the ring. Section is triangular and there are two circumferential incised lines parallel to the edge, between them small incised strokes forming a ribbed edge. The outer surface is very well polished, the inner face shows very fine drilling lines.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D14, east wall street
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
